newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil pension funds do want to bid on CVRD - Previ.
newsitem.headline: Brazil pension funds do want to bid on CVRD - Previ.

text.p: Brazil's largest pension fund Previ has denied statements that pension funds are not interested in participating in the privatization auction of state mining giant CVRD as members of a bidding consortium.

A director of the Brazilian association of pension funds, Abrapp, Ildemar Almeida da Silva, said Monday the pension funds would not take part in the auction and only planned to join the winning bidders afterwards.
A 45 percent voting stake in CVRD is being auctioned April 29 on the Rio de Janeiro stock exchange for a base price of 3 billion reais ($2.83 billion).
"We do want to participate in the auction," a Previ spokesman said. "The funds are negotiating as a block and we are in talks with the different consortia."
The group of seven pension funds -- Previ, Valia, Petros, Fapes, Cistel, Cesp, Funcef -- together already holds an 18 percent stake in CVRD and 15 percent of CVRD voting shares.
Whoever wins the 45 percent voting CVRD share block at auction would automatically acquire control if they have the pension funds on their side.
In exchange for their support, the funds want a seat on CVRD's board of directors once the company is privatized.
((-- Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
